713358f-a.text:
48th Street, north side, from Ninth to Eighth Avenue. In the centre is Faith Presbyterian Church, 355-365 West 48th Street.
May 3, 1930.

710200f-a.text:

New Madison Square Garden is in centre.

713349f-b.text:
West 48th Street, north side, west from (No. 241, right) a point east of Eighth Ave., and across same. Shown in the foreground and east of the N.E. corner is the Artef Theatre (No. 249). The large building appearing west of the Ave. is the Hotel Belvedere. At Ninth Ave. is discernible the Elevated structure. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

710199f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, east side, north from W. 48th Street, as photographed during the period of subway construction. The K.of C.ClubHotel is at the S. E. corner of 51st Street.
View 2 is limited to the 48th - 49th Street frontage.
View 1: Ortober 22, 1927
View 2: March 26, 1928
P. L. Sperr
